comments.comment: For the question he asked around 36:00 about why Elon Musk isn't addressing more problems on earth: I don't think it'd be a good allocation of resources if Elon Musk, a physics genius, were to focus on solving poverty and left the rocket science to someone else. There are a lot of people who want to solve social problems, there aren't a lot of people who can take us to Mars.

comments.comment: 38:06 I'll say it because Elon is either unwilling or unable to say it.  We need to become a multi-planetary species because if we do not, the human race will die.  Just know it. It's a fact. if we do not become a multi-planetary species within the next few generations, the likelihood is our species will be dead. Super-disasters or diseases will wipe us out. The human race will just be more fossils on this little world.   The solar system is a shooting gallery. We will get hit one of these days. The plates of the Earth are moving, one of these days they will shift dramatically as they have in the past, and we will lose millions, maybe billions, of lives. We have a large number of nuclear weapons, it's only a matter of time before a mistake is made and disaster strikes. ... That's not even touching diseases, or general climate change, or things like super volcanoes. These aren't scare tactics. These are facts. The human race needs to migrate not only our own kind off world, but samples of the entire planets eco system, so that they can thrive on many different worlds.

comments.comment: 39:52 Elon's honesty that this is a selfish interest of his (not wanting to be sad when thinking about future) is prime example of why I believe he is sincere and working smart and hard towards his aspirational goals which I share (in my capacity) and therefore support (in my capacity). A future where we are living more sustainably and not subject to so much inter-species competition and a future where we have opened the doors to an age of space exploration is one that presents infinite opportunity while also reducing need for conflict on our home world. It is a better future for my children and their children and generations that follow. That is worth working towards and supporting.

comments.comment: 34:45 "Why do we need to build a city on Mars with a million people on it in your lifetime? I think it's important to have a future that is inspiring and appealing. There are so many desperate things happening in the world right now, you shouldn't be thinking about this. You should be solving what's here now. I look at the future as a branching stream of possibilities and there are actions that we can take that affect those probabilities. Sustainable energy will happen no matter what. If there was no Tesla it would have to happen out of necessity. The fundamental value of a company like Tesla is the degree to which it accelerates the advent of sustainable energy faster than it would otherwise occur."
